greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the exact power of 2 that divides the n-th Fibonacci number (A000045).
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: If n is not divisible by 3 then a(n) = 1, if n = 3 * 2^k * (2m + 1) then a(n) = 2 if k=0 or 2^(k+2) if k>0.
a(n) = F(n) / A174883(n). - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Jan 24 2012
example: a(12) = 16 because the 12th Fibonacci number is 144 and 144 = 9*16.
results.author: Ahmed Fares (ahmedfares(AT)my-deja.com), May 04 2001
ext: More terms from Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), May 07 2001
